quest.name: Coming into Its Own
journal:
Ardashir is concerned about the anima's growth.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

The anima has grown at a rattling pace, absorbing large amounts of aether in the process. Ardashir fears this rapid development may exceed the limits of the soulstone serving as its base. To ensure all your hard work is not wasted, he plans to fortify the soulstone, as well as have Gerolt forge a new weapon to hold it. This new weapon, however, will require four materials essential for conducting large quantities of aether: enchanted rubber, fast-drying carboncoat, fast-acting Allagan catalyst, and divine water. Gerolt suggests seeking out a merchant named Cristiana at the House of Splendors in Mor Dhona who may have what he requires.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Cristiana's wares are limited, but she does, in fact, have what you seek. If only it were as simple as paying her in gil. She demands several expertly exotic goods in exchange for the materials Gerolt asked for. Whether you fashion them, find them, or trade for them, you must acquire what Gerolt needs if you are to complete the anima weapon.

You acquire the materials necessary to affix the anima's soulstone to a new weapon. Gerolt takes up his hammer and once again puts his legendary skills to work. The familiar ring of his hammer fills the air, but the medley soon comes to a halt. His latest masterpiece is complete, and your weapon is born anew! You hold it aloft, basking in its light, when what appears to be a sprite takes shape before you and thanks you for all you have done. You smile and nod, knowing your journey together has only just begun.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The anima's growth thus far is well beyond what I expected. By absorbing aether during our travels, it has matured enough to take on a form separate from the weapon, and even speak to Forename.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: To grow so quickly would have required a substantial amount of aether. However, the soulstone is not without its limits. As it continues to absorb aether and grow, I fear it may not bear the strain of further development.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer tellin' me after all the work I did, the anima could swell up like a Bombard an' burst!? Ye better have a plan to fix it, 'cause I sure as hells ain't startin' over.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Who exactly do you think you are talking to? This is my life's work, short a time as that may be. Of course I have a plan.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: If we can reinforce the soulstone and increase its capacity for aetheric energies, it should remain stable. I will speak with Rowena and see to collecting what we require.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ah, ye had me fooled when you was beggin' and pleadin' to see those Sharlayan books before. Good to know yer incompetence was only fer show. Well, seein' as ye have everythin' under control, if ye don't mind I think I'll─

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Run off to some tavern to get deep in your cups? Sadly you haven't the time nor the coin for it. Not when you have a new weapon to make for our friend Forename here.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A new weapon!? I just finished fixin' the one shehe has now. Why the hells do ye need another?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Just as we develop and change over time, it is only fitting the anima should as well. Or do you mean to tell me you were always such a gentleman, even as a child?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <sigh> It never ends, does it? Fine, if it'll help settle me debt with Rowena, ye'll have yer bleedin' weapon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If we're attachin' the soulstone to a new weapon, we're gonna need materials fer conductin' aether. That's where you come in.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I need ye to go and fetch me some enchanted rubber, fast-drying carboncoat, fast-acting Allagan catalyst, and divine water.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I know a lass in Mor Dhona what sells 'em─Cristiana's her name. Like as not, ye'll find her keepin' a corner somewhere at the House o' Splendors. They won't come cheap, but yer a resourceful sort. I'm sure ye'll think o' somethin'.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: This anima has grown remarkably fast. Judging by the rise in its aetheric levels, we'll soon need to reinforce the soulstone for this one as well.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Meanin' I have to fire up the forge again, eh? Well, Forename, that means there's work for you as well.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We're gonna need another round of enchanted rubber, fast-drying carboncoat, fast-acting Allagan catalyst, and divine water.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Go and speak with Cristiana at the House o' Splendors. She should be able to get you what we need.

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: A customer? A customer! You are a customer, aren't you? I mean, I realize this isn't a proper stall, but I do have wares to sell. That is, if, um, you're willing to buy them. Have you come to buy my wares?

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: Aether-conductive materials? I think I have what you're looking for, but it won't come cheap!

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: Truth be told, I don't get buyers for these items all that often, but now that I have you─my new favorite customer─I'm sure to turn a profit, and then I can build a stall of my very own!

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: But I don't want your gil! No, dealing with gil is much too messy. What with all the counting, and sorting, and finding a place to─ Ahem. Bartering is much simpler, don't you think? There are a few things I'd be willing to trade for, if you're interested.

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: A customer? A customer! Oh, and a returning one at that! You did come to buy something, didn't you? I mean, I realize this isn't a proper stall, but I still have wares to sell. That is, if, um, you're willing to buy them. Have you come to buy my wares?

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: Is that not what you asked for last time? I mean, I think that's what you asked for. I recall something about rubber and water, and─ Ahem, excuse me. If that's what you're looking for, then you know what I'll need in exchange.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The goods requested by Cristiana can be obtained through various means including dungeons, tribal quests, and crafting.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Speak with other players and share information to discover how to find them!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Get everythin' we need? Good. Hand it all over─the weapon, too.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ardashir's ready to work on the soulstone, and he won't shut up about it. At least now it'll all be over.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi, I thought ye said ye had everything we need!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's enchanted rubber, fast-drying carboncoat, fast-acting Allagan catalyst, and divine water. If yer missing somethin', hurry on back to Cristiana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Good on ye, lasslad. Now then, let's make us a weapon, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> Can't say I've ever forged somethin' quite so extraordinary. A weapon fit for yer growin' anima. Nay, something more than that.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Almace, a sword without equal. Together with Ancile, the gods themselves'd be hard-pressed to lay a blow on ye.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Verethragna. The gods themselves'd be jealous o' knuckles so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Ukonvasara. The gods themselves'd be jealous of an axe so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Rhongomiant. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a lance so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Gandiva. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a bow so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Majestas. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a staff so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Draconomicon. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a tome so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Tetrabiblos. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a tome so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Kannagi. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a pair o' blades so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Nothung. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a blade so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Armageddon. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a firearm so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Deneb. The gods themselves'd be jealous of an astrolabe so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Wait till Rowena takes a gander at this. We keep this up an' she'll be givin' me notes o' promise.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: To be honest, I once questioned what use I had for a drunkard with a hammer. But you have proven yourself to be quite the competent blacksmith─when you're sober.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Forename, I am at a loss as to how to express my thanks. You looked danger in the eye, unflinching, risking life and limb to help me. I hope someday I can repay your kindness.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: (Tch. Sure shehe carried it around a bit, but I made the damned thing! Don't I deserve a little more than left-handed compliments?)

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: What!? The anima manifested again? When?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But I didn't see anything. Are you certain?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Why is it that only you are able to see the anima when it chooses to present itself?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Maybe it's got no interest in the likes o' you.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I suppose the anima is not yet strong enough. Perhaps one day, after it has fully matured, we too will be able to behold its wonders.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: This calls to mind Thavnairian literature on the Zodiac Braves, legendary heroes who wielded arms of unparalleled strength.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But soon they will tell tales of a new legend─of you and your anima weapon!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now don't be gettin' ahead o' yerself, lad. There's no denying it's a beauty, but there's still room for improvement.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye just said yerself the anima ain't fully matured yet.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I do not need you to remind me of such things.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I have kept a rather comprehensive account of everything we have done thus far. With all the data I have collected, it is only a matter of time before the next step in fostering the anima is clear.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Which reminds me, Forename. If you would care to read over my notes on our work, you are more than welcome to pore over them at your leisure. They are on the table just over there.

dialogue.name: GEROL
dialogue.text: (Aye, that's the way, lad. Every step that brings us closer to finishin' this bleedin' weapon brings me a step closer to a life free from debt and that gil-swindlin' wench Rowena.)

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Again we have succeeded in creating an anima weapon! Excellent work.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: You say the anima has manifested itself yet again? That is good to hear.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Much like the last, I look forward to the day I can behold its wonder with my own eyes.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: All the more reason I must continue my research! Our work is without precedent, 'tis true, but I will not be deterred.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your weapon has been forged anew, and the anima's strength blossoms!
